_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Keys with _else are produced with non-trained Stanford NLP and as such only includes capitalized words. The + designates a segment range. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.
mn116:4.1+mn116:7.4^where_else_mentioned: Sumbha, Subha, Methula, Aṭṭhama, Anīgha, Sudāṭha, Santacitta, Upakāḷa, Vijita, Jita, Aṅga, Paṅga, Guttijita, Pavattar, Sarabhaṅga, Ketumbarāga, Mātaṅga, Ariya, Accuta, Accutagāma, Byāmaka, Sumaṅgala, Dabbila, Supatiṭṭhita, Asayha, Khemābhirata, Sorata, Bhāradvāja, Mahānāma, Jeta, Jayanta
mn116:4.1+mn116:7.4^who_else_mentioned: Buddhas, Isigili, Ariṭṭha, Upariṭṭha, Tagarasikhin, Yasassin, Sudassana, Piyadassin, Gandhāra, Piṇḍola, Upāsabha, Nītha, Tatha, Sutavā, Bhāvitatta, Assumegha, Hiṅgū, Hiṅga, Jāli, Aṭṭhaka, the Buddha Kosala, Subāhu, Upanemi, Nemi, Kāḷa, Passin, Aparājita, Māra, Satthar, Lomahaṁsa, Uccaṅgamāya, Asita, Anāsava, Manomaya, Bandhumant, Tadādhimutta, Durannaya, Saṅgha, Ujjaya, Sayha, Nandas, Upanandas, Bodhi, Kesin, Sikhin, Sundara, Tissa, Upatissa, Upasīdarin, Sīdarin, Maṅgala, Usabha, Upanīta, Uposatha, Saccanāma, Paduma, Uppala, Padumuttara, Rakkhita, Pabbata, Mānatthaddha, the Buddha Kaṇha
